---
category: Vue.js
topic: Two-Way Data Binding
questionType: { { $doc.questionType } }
explanationType: { { $doc.explanationType } }
difficulty: easy
options:
  - id: 1
    option: v-model:uppercase
  - id: 2
    option: v-model.uppercase
  - id: 3
    option: v-model-uppercase
  - id: 4
    option: v-model_uppercase
correctOptionId: 2
referenceLink: https://vuejs.org/guide/components/v-model.html#handling-v-model-modifiers
---

::question{:type="questionType"}
The code below shows how to implement a v-model with a custom modifier that transforms every letter to uppercase.

<br />

```js
<script setup>
const [model, modifiers] = defineModel({
  set(value) {
    if(modifiers.uppercase) {
      return value.toUpperCase()
    }

    return value
  }
})
</script>

<template>
  <input v-model="model" />
</template>
```

<br />

How can the consuming component use the uppercase modifier when passing v-model?

<br />

::playgroundLink{href="https://play.vuejs.org/#"}
::

::

::explanation{:type="explanationType"}

**Explanation: The uppercase modifier can be accessed via v-model.uppercase.**

<br />

```js
<template>
  <Input v-model.uppercase="firstName" />
</template>
```

::
